summary: gRPC connection to Temporal Cloud drops during RPC calls with '14 UNAVAILABLE: Connection dropped' error. The error persists even after reconnection attempts and keep-alive configuration. Resolved by switching from grpc.Credentials to TLSConfig for TLS certificate management.
userImpact: Users connecting to Temporal Cloud experience intermittent connection drops that require manual reconnection and retry logic.
rootCause: Improper TLS credential configuration using grpc.credentials.createSsl() instead of the SDK's TLSConfig API, which caused connection instability against Cloud deployments.
proposedFix: Use TLSConfig object with serverRootCACertificate and clientCertPair instead of grpc.credentials.createSsl() for mTLS connections.
workaround: Implement automatic reconnection and retry logic on connection drop errors, then switch to proper TLSConfig API.
resolutionDetails: Issue was resolved by the reporter by switching from grpc.Credentials.createSsl() to TLSConfig API for TLS certificate configuration.
keyQuote: I was eventually able to solve this by switching from using grpc.Credentials to use TLSConfig for specifying the TLS certs
